tweets.html:
I'd rather have a stranger spit in my mouth than a web page make noise.

— John O'Connor (@johntoconnor) March 13, 2013

Serious tweet: Either watch #Southland tonight, or you are a dumb smelly stupid face.

— Shawn Hatosy (@ShawnHatosy) March 13, 2013

Tonight Whitney will be on at 8 and 830 on NBC I'm so sorry about that

— Whitney Cummings (@WhitneyCummings) March 13, 2013

Say what you want about Whitney but it's definitely in the top 10 shows NBC airs at 8:00 on Wednesday nights.

— pilot (@pilotbacon) March 14, 2013

John is the sincerest form of Slattery.

— Rob Sheridan (@robertdsheridan) March 13, 2013

"A long time ago/we used to be friends/so give us money for a #VeronicaMars film."

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) March 13, 2013

There better be some Veronica Mars fans out there who actually have some freaking money. I'm going to rob a bank. Movie: She investigates.

— Alexa Planje (@HerQueue) March 13, 2013

I wasn't going to back the Veronica Mars movie kickstarter, but then I found out Piz was involved. I'M ALL IN. http://t.co/0xVZt5r8eH.

— Myles McNutt (@Memles) March 13, 2013

"Wait a second, we could've done a Kickstarter campaign? Dammit!" -- Hopelessly deluded AMC execs, re: The Killing's third season.

— Josh Spiegel (@mousterpiece) March 13, 2013

tweets.author_name: Amy celebrates Wrinkle in Time instead of XMas
tweets.html:
Hey, how much money would I need to donate to the kickstarter for them to promise no rape apologies in the #VMars movie?

— Amy celebrates Wrinkle in Time instead of XMas (@spooloflies) March 13, 2013

Hell will hath no fury like fans who think they are buying live-action Veronica/Logan fanfic.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) March 13, 2013

I want a #ZeroHour kickstarter. How many Nazi clocks do we need to sell to make this a reality? ZESE CLOCKS! WE MUST FUND ZESE CLOCKS!

— Deck The Hal-Les (@Lesismore9o9) March 13, 2013

Weevil's Advocate: Every dollar donated to the Veronica Mars Kickstarter puts you a dollar further from a Party Down movie.

— Erik Adams (@ErikMAdams) March 13, 2013

Kickstarter to revive DuMont! RT @ThisWasTV @ZeppoMarxist considers DuMont's Tuesday lineup in 1952-53 http://t.co/zLc4rjnx3H …

— Robert D Sullivan (@RobertDSullivan) March 13, 2013

Kickstarter for a 3rd season of Smash, but recast with drag queens and hand puppets and airing on Logo! Who's with me?

— Mark Harris (@MarkHarrisNYC) March 13, 2013

For $20,000 Courtney Taylor-Taylor will pretend that you and he use to be friends. #vmarskickstarter

— inessentials (@inessentials) March 13, 2013

For $40,000 the movie will be shot at Steve Guttenberg's house and feature a live reading of Roman's hard sci-fi script. #vmarskickstarter

— inessentials (@inessentials) March 13, 2013

For $50,000 I'll stop tweeting these. #vmarskickstarter

— inessentials (@inessentials) March 13, 2013

tweets.author_name: Moved on Her Like a Bitch but Couldn't Get There
tweets.html:
If Joss Whedon somehow gets attached to the VERONICA MARS project Twitter will bend in on itself and form a black hole.

— Moved on Her Like a Bitch but Couldn't Get There (@AmandaAnnKlein) March 13, 2013

How much do I have to donate for Kristen Bell's husband's show to be renewed?

— (((Andrew Rabin)))📎 (@arrabin56) March 13, 2013

PRESENT TENSE. LOVE NEVER DIES. RT @michaelhayes: Wow, people really loved Veronica Mars http://t.co/sdnL5dTY9C

— Ellie Hall (@ellievhall) March 13, 2013

The way Veronica Mars fandom made me feel in 2005 is a way I always, always want to feel. Take my money! http://t.co/VPFrvLzYWv

— Kathryn VanArendonk (@kvanaren) March 13, 2013

the veronica mars s3 intro was the piz of intros.

— Scaremy Jingleghost (@JeremyMonjo) March 13, 2013

I should start a Kickstarter for me to buy DVDs of The Wire. You guys would pay for me to watch that, right?

— (((Andrew Rabin)))📎 (@arrabin56) March 13, 2013

Rob Thomas just built a time machine to show us what Wednesday mornings in 2005 would've looked like with Twitter. #vmarskickstarter

— inessentials (@inessentials) March 13, 2013

A whole lot of people on Twitter now have "We Used to Be Friends" stuck in their heads for the rest of the day. #bonus #veronicamars

— Chris Becker (@crsbecker) March 13, 2013

If this Veronica Mars thing pans out, you might see my Kickstarter for a movie where the Freaks and Geeks stowaway on the ship from Firefly.

— Daniel Kibblesmith ⛄️⚔️☃️ (@kibblesmith) March 13, 2013

I'll donate to a Kickstarter preventing any future Adam Sandler movies RIGHT NOW.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) March 13, 2013

If there's more than $2 million raised, can we get a Logan/Weevil buddy cop movie made with the excess? That would be great. #VeronicaMars

— Deck The Hal-Les (@Lesismore9o9) March 13, 2013

Here we go... RT @ShawnRyanTV: Very interested to see how this Veronica Mars kickstarter goes. Could be a model for a Terriers wrap up film.

— alisa perren (@aperren) March 13, 2013

YOU HAD ME AT "COULD BE." MT @ShawnRyanTV Very interested to see how V. Mars kickstarter goes. Could be a model for a Terriers wrap up film.

— Andy Greenwald (@andygreenwald) March 13, 2013

AAAAAAA #MADMEN #TERRIERS #VERONICAMARS AAAAAA (My impression of the Internet right now.)

— Deck The Hal-Les (@Lesismore9o9) March 13, 2013

Can we raise $2 million and get #HIMYM to reveal the mother by the end of the season?

— (((Andrew Rabin)))📎 (@arrabin56) March 13, 2013

@pilotbacon kickstarter to give us $1,000 for the veronica mars kickstarter so we can go to LA & force logan to tell us our love is epic IRL

— terminally chill (@benewavvy) March 13, 2013

I’ve pledged $25 for the Veronica Mars movie. My only request is that the movie ends with Veronica *finally* getting a pony.

— The Gretch Who Stole Christmas (@gretchenalice) March 13, 2013

Veronica Mars movie kickstarter! I gave; I would pay 35$ to watch Logan and Weevil fold laundry for 1.5 hrs.

— Kirsten Strayer 🌹 (@kirsten_amy) March 13, 2013

kickstarter for mad men season six to open with a booming voice-over saying "PREVIOUSLY ON 'THE NEGRON COMPLEX'"

— Scaremy Jingleghost (@JeremyMonjo) March 13, 2013

How much more money would they raise if they had put a sloth in that kickstarter video? #VeronicaMarsMovie

— ishira kumar (@ishirakumar) March 13, 2013

If I bought the $400 package could I make Kristen Bell record me a Kickstarter video to fund my life?

— ishira kumar (@ishirakumar) March 13, 2013

Judging by how fast that #VeronicaMarsMovie kickstarter is moving, it wasn't all that long ago and we are still friends.

— BurnThemAll (@aboleyn) March 13, 2013

Wouldn't be surprised to find myself tweeting, "Hey, if you kill your neighbor, ABC Family will make a new season of Huge. Here's a knife."

— Emily Nussbaum (@emilynussbaum) March 13, 2013

kickstarter for cult, but the show within the show cult, not the actual show cult

— Scaremy Jingleghost (@JeremyMonjo) March 13, 2013

Tho VMars film never seemed outside realm of possibility because Kristen always kept the hope alive. Fandom goes both ways.

— Cameron White (@JediDusk) March 13, 2013

Seriously though, this Veronica movie model could end up saving shows. Mainly, I'd give a month's paycheck for 15 more seconds of BUNHEADS.

— Marcus Michalik (@MarcusMichalik) March 13, 2013

The joke's on all of us: This Veronica Mars Kickstater is just so Bell can buy herself a private sloth preserve.

— Noel Kirkpatrick (@noelrk) March 13, 2013

How much do I have to give to receive the role of Veronica's new boring boyfriend she eventually leaves to go back to Logan?

— Poe Daar-meron (@AndrewDaar) March 13, 2013

Really what i'm trying to say through the medium of sandwich eating is that this Veronica Mars thing is just like the Arab Spring isn't it.

— Daniel Bettridge (@DanielBettridge) March 13, 2013

Is there a kickstarter where I can give @louisck money to get started on Pootie Tang 2?

— Christian Lander (@clander) March 13, 2013

tweets.author_name: cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future
tweets.html:
Seriously, I'm throwing in money just for getting to here Ryan Hansen say, "What? I'm not the one with When In Rome Fuck You money." #VMars

— cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future (@sarCCastro) March 13, 2013

If I'm being honest, I'd probably pay $10 just to watch Jason Dohring scrub pots and pans for 90 minutes.

— Julie Hammerle🔨 (@JulieHammerle) March 13, 2013

@Lesismore9o9 The movie should have Veronica follow the money donated to a dubious Kickstarter campaign.

— Poe Daar-meron (@AndrewDaar) March 13, 2013

Is Kyle Gallner allowed to buy his way into the #VeronicaMars movie with a walk on role?! http://t.co/aiK0pgtw8H

— the TV Addict (@theTVaddict) March 13, 2013

Have we yet discussed how awesome late-20s Mac is gonna be for the Veronica Mars movie? That's worth mentioning.

— Rowan Kaiser (@RowanKaiser) March 13, 2013

I probably won't give any money to a Veronica Mars movie Kickstarter. A DUNCAN KANE movie Kickstarter, on the other hand...

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) March 13, 2013

Is the Veronica Mars Kickstarter a deduction?

— Chris Regan (@ChrisRRegan) March 13, 2013

The Veronica Mars movie is finally going to happen. Google is killing Reader. #theuniversegiveth #theuniversetakethaway

— Jennifer Schaefer (@jlschaefer) March 13, 2013

I bet Mac uses Google Reader. #veronicamars

— Chris Becker (@crsbecker) March 14, 2013

It would be funny if the Veronica Mars movie turned out to be terrible.

— Richard Lawson (@rilaws) March 13, 2013

Feeling guilty/weird about giving money to Warner Bros for Veronica Mars? Match your donation at the charity of your choice. Then be quiet.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) March 14, 2013

LET US HAVE THIS

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) March 14, 2013

"I have a message for the future, and you're not going to like it: Rob Thomas has asked VM fans to volunteer THEIR OWN MYSTERIES for FREE."

— Bah, Handlen! (@zhandlen) March 14, 2013

What'll be interesting is when this evolves, as game Kickstarters have, into, "Hi, I'm [beloved showrunner]. I want to make an indie film."

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) March 14, 2013

What happens then? How extensive is your attachment to Jason Katims?

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) March 14, 2013

*Spontaneously bursts into tears, gets checkbook out* RT @tvoti: What happens then? How extensive is your attachment to Jason Katims?

— Chris Becker (@crsbecker) March 14, 2013

RT @tvoti: What happens then? How extensive is your attachment to Jason Katims? // KAREN SISCO remake!!!!

— Jason Mittell (@jmittell) March 14, 2013

On my way home, I might throw a $20 bill over the gate at WB Lot, hopefully they'll kickstart that into a better cut of #TheDarkKnightRises

— robert kessler (@thebobkessler) March 14, 2013

Kickstarter for a second season of Luck but David Milch plays all the horses in full costume

— David Sims (@davidlsims) March 14, 2013

Hey guys, our plan to kickstart #Smash to Saturdays worked!!

— robert kessler (@thebobkessler) March 14, 2013

Anyway, I can't believe we're talking about this when Bunheads is still in peril.

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) March 14, 2013

tweets.author_name: cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future
tweets.html:
BREAKING: Internet divided over the idea of whether or not it's a good thing for people to pay money for something they want.

— cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future (@sarCCastro) March 14, 2013

complaining about how the money might have gone to a better cause seems kinda ridiculous, unless you believe that media is meaningless

— Rowan Kaiser (@RowanKaiser) March 14, 2013

I watched Veronica Mars first-run. If you didn't, you can give money, but you DON'T GET TO TALK TO ME ABOUT IT.

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) March 14, 2013

"Oh, gosh, this was a great show. I can't believe it got canceled and I only found out about it on Netflix!" #frothsatmouth #killsfirstborn

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) March 14, 2013

So, need info on how to create a Kickstarter for an ARRESTED DEVELOPMENT movie and also on countries that do not extradite to the US

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) March 14, 2013

The thought of a Chuck film makes me seriously consider arson.

— Libby Hill (@midwestspitfire) March 14, 2013

OK, it's nearly been a full day. I think we can ratchet back the Kickstarter jokes now.

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) March 14, 2013

I like how Kristen Bell's expression seems to get that much smugger with each new chunk of change: http://t.co/TjeKi8wmEm

— Bah, Handlen! (@zhandlen) March 14, 2013

@zhandlen are we kickstarting airbrushed CW Bell or the down-to-earth UPN Bell? This is important.

— Rowan Kaiser (@RowanKaiser) March 14, 2013

In conclusion: Kickstarter is great. Fans are weird. This will not get you a Duckman movie.

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) March 14, 2013

If this pace keeps up, the Veronica Mars movie will have spaceships, huge battle scenes, and a Gollum-ified Keith Mars.

— Poe Daar-meron (@AndrewDaar) March 14, 2013

Primetime ratings are really going to be affected by all the people watching the #VeronicaMarsMovie Kickstarter reach its goal instead.

— Myles McNutt (@Memles) March 14, 2013

The 1st AD on the #VeronicaMars movie is terrified of this thing getting funded.

— MavisGaryVEVO (@MisterMcCracken) March 14, 2013

I love Veronica Mars and everything but can I just throw all of my money at HBO to keep Enlightened on the air?

— pilot (@pilotbacon) March 14, 2013

...aaaaaaand DONE #VeronicaMarsMovie

— meaning machine (@EricThurm) March 14, 2013

TWO MILLION DOLLARS. Is this real life?

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) March 14, 2013

Six years after cancellation, #VeronicaMars has raised $2 million in less than half a day. Time for The CW to issue a public apology.

— Richie (@RichieOnTV) March 14, 2013

I wonder if Kristen Bell prefers $2 million or sloths?

— (((Andrew Rabin)))📎 (@arrabin56) March 14, 2013

Veronica Mars passes $2 million on Kickstarter. Which is close, I fear, to what it will bring in at the box office.

— Robert Bianco (@BiancoRobert) March 14, 2013

What if "the Veronica Mars movie" is a two-minute iPhone video of Kristen Bell dumping gasoline on $2 million in cash and watching it burn?

— Brian Grubb (@briancgrubb) March 14, 2013

The Veronica Mars goal has been reached, so people are now apparently funding the catering. #enough #givetocharity #itsatvshowforgodssake

— Mark Harris (@MarkHarrisNYC) March 14, 2013

Fans are going to be disappointed to learn that 30 minutes of the #VeronicaMarsMovie's runtime is Special Thanks credits to funders.

— Poe Daar-meron (@AndrewDaar) March 14, 2013

Meanwhile, the Kickstarter for the movie of THE CAPE quietly enters its third year

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) March 14, 2013

All "Veronica Mars" Kickstarter funds above $2 million go crafting to her new sidekick Jar-Jar.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) March 14, 2013

At 11am I messaged a friend to suggest the Veronica Mars Kickstarter campaign was probably doomed. So - anybody want some investment tips?

— Adam Barken (@adambarken) March 14, 2013

a kickstarter for a manimal: the musical movie

— BUM CHILLUPS (@edsbs) March 14, 2013

Already have friends emailing me about getting together in the same city to watch the Veronica Mars movie on the big screen. #fandom

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) March 14, 2013

one final note on Veronica Mars: it is the smartest show about class I've ever seen, and also did well with race and gender.

— Rowan Kaiser (@RowanKaiser) March 14, 2013

Well now that #VeronicaMars has cured leprosy I can dream happy dreams. Thanks found family for a really exciting day. Night.

— BurnThemAll (@aboleyn) March 14, 2013

So how bout that Veronica Mars #astute #topical #comment

— will brooker (@willbrooker) March 14, 2013

I kind of hope the Veronica Mars crew just releases a video tomorrow of them doing $2 million of Kickstarter cocaine.

— Mark Lisanti (@marklisanti) March 14, 2013

To everyone who helped my most beautiful, nerdy angel (@IMKristenBell ) today, THANK YOU!!!

— dax shepard (@daxshepard1) March 14, 2013

@daxshepard1 I've never been prouder to be Veronica Braverman :)

— Kristen Bell (@IMKristenBell) March 14, 2013

The final tweet. Nothing will top this. It's over. RT @IMKristenBell: @daxshepard1 I've never been prouder to be Veronica Braverman :)

— (((Andrew Rabin)))📎 (@arrabin56) March 14, 2013

“@IMKristenBell: @daxshepard1 I've never been prouder to be Veronica Braverman :)”

GUYS THIS IS THE BEST NIGHT OF MY LIFE

— mae whitman (@maebirdwing) March 14, 2013

HOW ARE THERE FOUR SLOTH BOTS ON TWITTER?!?

— (((Andrew Rabin)))📎 (@arrabin56) March 14, 2013

#HouseofCards kinda was the sign, but this #VeronicaMars news gives a fixed point in history to say this is the day it all changed.

— Kel "Jingle Jangle Bells" K. (@TVKel) March 14, 2013

A whole bunch of network execs are going to arrive to work tomorrow and wonder why they are paying so much for pilots they won't air. #VM

Veronica Mars is nice, but can we pool collective $$ to make sure there ISN'T an Entourage movie? Like Kickstarter, but Kickstopper?

How much of the Veronica Mars film budget will have to be spent on protecting Kristen Bell from entitled crazy-person fans?

— Devan Joneson (@djoneson) March 14, 2013

Y'all give me one hundred dollars and two cases of beer and I'll make a Veronica Mars movie right goddamn now

How come nobody told me this Bible series on History Channel was a comedy?

— Masked Scheduler (@maskedscheduler) March 14, 2013

What color smoke means that "Veronica Mars" has secured its Kickstarter funding?

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) March 13, 2013

"For $600, a Cardinal of your choosing (not Dolan) will record a 15 second voice mail record in 2 different languages" #KickstarterPope

— (((Andrew Rabin)))📎 (@arrabin56) March 13, 2013

Thank God this seagull showed up. @CNN was starting to get really bored. New pope apparently not as exciting as poop cruise.

— Cassie Belek (@cassiebelek) March 13, 2013

CNN Anchor 1: Shall we cover real news? CNN Anchor 2: Yes, Let's go. [They do not move.] #WaitingForPapalSmoke

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) March 13, 2013

White smoke seen at Vatican. #Pope chosen. Final tally: 4,234,123 BBQ jokes. 2,312,552 pot jokes. 1 Ron Popeil Joke. #WhiteSmoke

— Crutnacker (@Crutnacker) March 13, 2013

BREAKING: Vatican Has Either Chosen New Pope, or Is Making Meth #BreakingFallible

— Rob Kutner (@ApocalypseHow) March 13, 2013

For this generation, the new Pope will be forever linked with a cancelled TV show and a whole lotta Twitter jokes.

— Adam Barken (@adambarken) March 13, 2013

Does white smoke mean #VeronicaMars Kickstarter funding goal met? Or that Enlightened ot renewed? Pls clarify, cardinals.

— Mo Ryan (@moryan) March 13, 2013

Also, when the #VernonicaMarsMovie is kickstart'd, Rob Thomas should tweet "Habemus Mars." #tryingingtoohard

— TV MoJoe (@TVMoJoe) March 13, 2013

The new #Pope gets to pick his Papal name, but the runner up will forever be known as Father Justin Guarini henceforth.

Good possible Pope names that still haven't been used: Bradley, Anfernee, Peyton, T-Dog, Cody.

— Mark Harris (@MarkHarrisNYC) March 13, 2013

If I were named Pope, I'd take the name "Pope Handsome B. Wonderful the First" #PopeSimpsons

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) March 13, 2013

If the Vatican really wanted to create some buzz they would tweet the new Pope’s name one letter at a time. #WhiteSmoke

I think it would be great if Benedict pulled a Favre and came back for one Advent season. Or became the leader of the Episcopalians.

If you’re not watching the TV right now, essentially all anchors are filling time by saying “just look at the CROWDS” over and over again.

Meet The New Pope, Same As The Old Pope. CSI: Vatican City Theme Song

— Crutnacker (@Crutnacker) March 13, 2013

Through the white smoke emerges The Doctor, in full ceremonial regalia. "Papal Tiaras are coooool," he says. #DoctorWho #conclave

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) March 13, 2013

What this Pope reality show needs is @RuPaul sitting there on the balcony & evaluating: "Shantay, you stay" or "Sashay away."

— Mo Ryan (@moryan) March 13, 2013

Kanye addressing Vatican crowd: Vi farò finire, ma John Paul II è stato il migliore papa nella storia.

— pourmecoffee (@pourmecoffee) March 13, 2013

I'm guessing the Cardinals voted for the guy who *was* there to make friends. #habemaspapum

— Adam Bonin (@adambonin) March 13, 2013

Weird choice, but I guess I'm into it. pic.twitter.com/zLyT3l6pjE

— Mike Hayes (@michaelhayes) March 13, 2013

Waiting for FOX to announce "New Pope" sitcom. Adoremus? He's adorkable.

— David J. Loehr (@dloehr) March 13, 2013

What I imagine CBS and Probst are thinking now: Too bad the new pope can't be a returnee.

Don't feel bad for the runner-up Popes. They still get a 2014 Ford Fiesta, a year's supply of Coke Zero and a contract with Epic Records.

I mock, but this Papal announcement won't have meaning until Guilana and Ross Matthews giggle about his vestaments.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) March 13, 2013

The Pope has a marching band? Do Tusk! DO TUSK!!!

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) March 13, 2013

News people killing time by bullshitting while pretending they know their shit: endlessly entertaining. #newpope

— Andy Dehnart (@realityblurred) March 13, 2013

FOR SALE: Unused Papal conclave tweets, good condition, marginally funny. $5 OBO

— Rex Huppke (@RexHuppke) March 13, 2013

Dear Any Public Figure That Has Been Hiding Something: Today would be the day to disclose it. Ain't nobody gonna pay attention.

#Pope looks down at scepter in his hands and gilded Prada slippers and quietly whispers, "It came true."

— itsonlyzach (@itsonlyzach) March 13, 2013

By getting people to stop tweeting about #SXSW, this new pope has already performed his first miracle.

"Now, if we could just get the Pope on a stranded cruise liner......." -- CNN Producer

I have high hopes for Pope Rambaldi XLVII. #conclave #Alias

THIS is what happens when #Scandal goes off for a few weeks. Look out Olivia, there's a new Pope in town.

— ishira kumar (@ishirakumar) March 13, 2013

Did The Vatican learn nothing from Netflix? They should release the next 12 popes all at once!

It will take us a while to get used to a new Pope, but once we've seen a couple of new episodes, and he's beaten the Daleks, we'll love him.

I'm kind of hoping the new pope turns out to be a member of England's most notorious dynasty. Pope Edmund the First! #Blackadder

I'm not saying it will happen. I'm just saying "Poprah" works really well.

I hope the new pope retweets people more

surprised james franco isn't the new pope. does that joke make sense? cause james franco does lots of stuff? oh, i don't know anymore

I want the new pope to get into a fracas with the singer of 'Torn'. Then we could have a Bergoglio-Imbruglia Imbroglio.

I will refer to the new Pope as Frankie and you can't tell me no. In other news, I'm almost done with season 4 of The Sopranos.

Uhhhh what did I miss? The new Pope is going to do a Veronica Mars movie?

@letloverule42 Yes he is totally going to be the big bad.

Today was weird. Like, WOO KICKSTARTER, eh Pope?, oh god humiliation, oh god rejected should I give up fiction, I can't, must write review.

11 years ago today we had ratings news that forever changed FX and basic cable TV: The Shield series debut delivered 4.8 million viewers.

What's wrong w/ network model, 2013: The longest stretch of original eps of #ParksAndRec this season? 3 weeks. At least one repeat per month

I expect NBC is currently sacrificing all manner of goats in the hopes #Revolution returns strong.

Google Reader is to Twitter as a well-labeled filing cabinet is to a bag of insane cats.

#Google is all about supporting the informational needs of its users. Unless it can't be monetized. Then not so much. #GoogleReader

we did it fans Veronica Mars is getting the 8 pm hour at MSNBC

Idol just showed footage of Kelly Clarkson winning and I cried WHATEVER THIS IS AN EMOTIONAL DAY.
